title: Worst Matchmaking Oceania
body:
Is there so little players that it matched me, a level 6 player, vs a level 30 with over **700 wins** in Blind Pick.


What the actual hell. I can't even afford a 3150 IP champion yet, or take smite, and I get matched against that? What happened to solo queue attempting to get me a game with players my level? Like, sub-10?!

replies.body: oceania has a small player base. Matchmaking like this is kind of granted considering only a small number of "less than level 10" players are active at any given time (like a teensy amount).

> [{quoted}](name=yaiamone,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=HxllbNEW,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-02-25T12:28:39.778+0000)
>
> oceania has a small player base. Matchmaking like this is kind of granted considering only a small number of "less than level 10" players are active at any given time (like a teensy amount).
play teemo this will have the lvl 30 raging

> [{quoted}](name=yaiamone,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=HxllbNEW,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-02-25T12:28:39.778+0000)
>
> oceania has a small player base. Matchmaking like this is kind of granted considering only a small number of "less than level 10" players are active at any given time (like a teensy amount).

play teemo this will have the lvl 30 raging
Quit complaining. I was on a level 3 account with 0 previous PVP match history and I got paired against a Platinum 3 Olaf with 50 ranked games with the champion and still won. Get over it.

is an NA smurf....complains about needing to vs lvl 30s....bronze 5 smurf? no REAL smurf would complain about pub games....

also, the idea is to play beginner bots till lvl 10, and int bots to lvl 20. thats why the IP rewards are set up the way they are....infact in korea and garena, its locked out from playing pvp till lvl 13 and 15 respectively.

This is a very common thing when there's low density of players on a given server the que system kinda works like this :

Que Like hidden MMR players > Time in que >  Availability >    The systems first response goes Ok do we have people of same mmr if yes than it ques you all together if that answers no than it goes to its next set of parameters.  It will wait for a set amount of time the longer the time the more it widens these parameters till finally boom you're in a que with a random lvl 30.  

Group MMR is a average of all players in the group so effectively a lvl 30 with 6s could lower himself down to a effective lvl   of 10 - 11 which means your team was more than likely equaled out with a 20 or multiple +10s

i was level 10 on my smurf versed plats and golds 

its awesome

> Quit complaining. I was on a level 3 account with 0 previous PVP match history and I got paired against a Platinum 3 Olaf with 50 ranked games with the champion and still won. Get over it.


Yeah but you're not going to know that without going stalker-mode. And if anything that just proves my point what kind of terrible matchmaking there is if that's possible.

Why the hell is sub-30 overrun with Smurfs? I'm not sure I've seen a single player that's actually NEW to the game yet.


> is an NA smurf....complains about needing to vs lvl 30s....bronze 5 smurf? no REAL smurf would complain about pub games....
> 
> also, the idea is to play beginner bots till lvl 10, and int bots to lvl 20. thats why the IP rewards are set up the way they are....infact in korea and garena, its locked out from playing pvp till lvl 13 and 15 respectively.


I'm a Oceania "smurf", who's main is on NA and never left NA when the server came up. Mostly because NA seemed to get stuff earlier and isn't going to be closed down due to lack of population (ie another game I played). Unfortunately, that meant I was always playing with sub-optimal connection and 30's has slowly become more and more of a cesspool of the ranked rejects so I just had enough and made another account on Oceania this time. Evidently I didn't log into that one by reflex... lol


And I don't think it should be a shock that a player who can't afford a 3150 IP champ yet nor take smite shouldn't have to face off against 6300 IP non-freeweek champs who CAN take smite, Flash, and everything else. That's just blatant pay-to-win against other players... who are MEANT to be new to the game already.

Seemingly everyone sub-30 is a smurf and just as abusive as the 30's though, it's pretty sad.

>And I don't think it should be a shock that a player who can't afford a 3150 IP champ yet nor take smite shouldn't have to face off against 6300 IP non-freeweek champs who CAN take smite, Flash, and everything else. That's just blatant pay-to-win against other players...

IP is now pay to win.

GG

IP is not pay-to-win.

The level 10-12 Vi who outright admitted to buying their champ with RP (it took me to level 8 to earn 3150 IP) is pay to win. Every bit of IP not spent on champs can go straight to runes for a direct ingame advantage.



It's not rocket science, paying RP to unlock FOTM 6300 IP champions before you even get stuff like Smite is just to roflstomp all over people who don't. Doesn't make for any kind of fair matchmaking.
probably wanted to feel good, so he partied up with low level friends.
